Then, when they came back, those genes weren't present anymore, so they couldn't reproduce. That fits with the founder effect because it's about a new population arising after a disaster. Also, the fact that they could come back together 150 years later indicates that the issue wasn't due to ongoing gene flow but rather a sudden disruption. So option D, founder effect, makes sense.
